description:
I installed nova according to the instructions of Installing Multiple Machines. All services are started, then I tried to start an instance with euca-run-instances, where I met the following errors.

NotFound: No network for bridge br100

I found that in file "/usr/lib/pymodules/python2.6/nova/db/sqlalchemy/api.py" the message would be output. And it is something related with db, so I confirmed the table "networks" of db nova, where the contents of column "bridge" are all NULL. 

I thought it seemed a bug that updating column "bridge" of table "network" was forgotten.
title: Error 'NotFound: No network for bridge br100' occured when starting an instance.

comments.content: Which network mode are you using ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content: In Flat networking mode, you have to set up the networking bridge on the network and compute nodes manually... Did you setup that ?
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~ttx

comments.content:
Yes, I had setup it on the compute nodes like the followings.

auto lo
iface lo inet loopback

auto br100
iface br100 inet static
          bridge_ports    eth0
          bridge_stp      off
          bridge_maxwait  0
          bridge_fd       0
        address 192.168.32.202
        netmask 255.255.255.0
        network 192.168.32.0
        broadcast 192.168.32.255
        gateway 192.168.32.254
        # dns-* options are implemented by the resolvconf package, if installed
        dns-nameservers 172.30.16.226
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~guanxiaohua2k6

comments.content: did you use a flagfile when using nova-manage to create the network? IIRC when using nova-manage without the specific flag the VlanManager is used as default networking mode
comments.author: https://api.launchpad.net/1.0/~armando-migliaccio

comments.content: yes, I set  "--network_manager=nova.network.manager.FlatManager" in the flag file.
